verb.description: Take (something) away or off from the position occupied.
examples: Customs officials removed documents from the premises
she sat down to remove her make-up
they removed thousands of needy youngsters from the system
the iron can be removed by filtration
it is an isolated place, far removed from the London art world

verb.description: Separated by a particular number of steps of descent.

noun.description: A degree of remoteness or separation.
examples: at this remove, the whole incident seems insane

origin: Middle English (as a verb): from the Old French stem remov-, from Latin removere, from re- back + movere to move.
